input_sentence: If the ego vehicle is not part of congestion or if the directly leading vehicle is not standing, then stopping on the main carriage way, shoulder lane, or ramps is forbidden.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle is part of congestion
Ego vehicle is stopping on main carriageway
Ego vehicle is stopping on shoulder lane
Ego vehicle is stopping on ramps

temporal_relations.description: If ego is not in congestion OR leading vehicle is not standing, then stopping on main carriageway, shoulder lane, or ramps is forbidden

lexicon.ego_in_congestion: Ego vehicle is part of congestion
lexicon.stop_main: Ego vehicle is stopping on main carriageway
lexicon.stop_shoulder: Ego vehicle is stopping on shoulder lane
lexicon.stop_ramps: Ego vehicle is stopping on ramps

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_leading → leading_vehicle

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: part_of_congestion(ego)
   - ap_2: standing(leading_vehicle) 
   - ap_3: stopping_on_main_carriageway(ego)
   - ap_4: stopping_on_shoulder_lane(ego)
   - ap_5: stopping_on_ramps(ego)

3. Map the conditional relation:
   - Antecedent: (~part_of_congestion(ego) | ~standing(leading_vehicle))
   - Consequent: ~(stopping_on_main_carriageway(ego) | stopping_on_shoulder_lane(ego) | stopping_on_ramps(ego))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator
5. Combine into implication: G((antecedent) -> (consequent))

Final MTL Formula:
G((~part_of_congestion(ego) | ~standing(leading_vehicle)) -> ~(stopping_on_main_carriageway(ego) | stopping_on_shoulder_lane(ego) | stopping_on_ramps(ego)))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_leading → leading_vehicle

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: part_of_congestion(ego)
   - ap_2: standing(leading_vehicle) 
   - ap_3: stopping_on_main_carriageway(ego)
   - ap_4: stopping_on_shoulder_lane(ego)
   - ap_5: stopping_on_ramps(ego)

3. Map the conditional relation:
   - Antecedent: (~part_of_congestion(ego) | ~standing(leading_vehicle))
   - Consequent: ~(stopping_on_main_carriageway(ego) | stopping_on_shoulder_lane(ego) | stopping_on_ramps(ego))

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator
5. Combine into implication: G((antecedent) -> (consequent))

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, meaning "Always" or "Globally".
- The implication `->` indicates a conditional relationship: if the left-hand side is true, then the right-hand side must be true.
- Left side of implication: `(~part_of_congestion(ego) | ~standing(leading_vehicle))`
  - `part_of_congestion(ego)` translates to "ego vehicle is part of congestion"
  - `standing(leading_vehicle)` translates to "leading vehicle is standing"
  - The negations `~` become "is not" for each predicate
  - The disjunction `|` becomes "or"
  - So: "ego vehicle is not part of congestion OR leading vehicle is not standing"
- Right side of implication: `~(stopping_on_main_carriageway(ego) | stopping_on_shoulder_lane(ego) | stopping_on_ramps(ego))`
  - The three stopping predicates describe ego's location when stopped
  - The disjunction `|` between them becomes "or"
  - The outer negation `~` applies to the entire disjunction, making it "must not be stopping" in any of these locations
- The entire formula is a safety constraint that must hold at all times.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is not part of congestion or the leading vehicle is not standing, then the ego vehicle must not be stopping on the main carriageway, shoulder lane, or ramps.

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
